entry.title: Khovanskii bases of Cox-Nagata rings and tropical geometry
entry.summary: The Cox ring of a del Pezzo surface of degree 3 has a distinguished set of 27 minimal generators. We investigate conditions under which the initial forms of these generators generate the initial algebra of this Cox ring. Sturmfels and Xu provide a classification in the case of degree 4 del Pezzo surfaces by subdividing the tropical Grassmannian $\operatorname{TGr}(2,\mathbb{Q}^5)$. After providing the necessary background on Cox-Nagata rings and Khovanskii bases, we review the classification obtained by Sturmfels and Xu. Then we describe our classification problem in the degree 3 case and its connections to tropical geometry. In particular, we show that two natural candidates, $\operatorname{TGr}(3,\mathbb{Q}^6)$ and the Naruki fan, are insufficient to carry out the classification.
